metadata.title: Robustness of the reproductive number estimates in vector-borne disease systems Supplementary material Individual Based Model

abstract.original_text: We employed a spatially-explicit IBM motivated by the one previously proposed by Lourenço and Recker (2013)

sentences.segment_text: We employed a spatially-explicit IBM motivated by the one previously proposed by Lourenço and Recker ( 2013 )

abstract.original_text: Initially, a disease-free stochastic individual based model for the hosts and vectors of the virus was constructed with no spatial component, and time t discretized into days. Daily, individual humans and vectors were aged, and terminated if their age exceeded their life expectancy. Only the adult stage of a vector's life cycle was considered, since only adult vectors generally acquire and transmit the vector-borne disease. We assumed age-dependent mortalities for both the hosts and the vectors. For both the host and vector, this is governed a Weibull distribution.

sentences.segment_text: Initially , a disease-free stochastic individual based model for the hosts and vectors of the virus was constructed with no spatial component ,
and time t discretized into days .
Daily , individual humans and vectors were aged ,
and terminated if their age exceeded their life expectancy .
Only the adult stage of a vector 's life cycle was considered ,
since only adult vectors generally acquire and transmit the vector-borne disease .
We assumed age-dependent mortalities for both the hosts and the vectors .
For both the host and vector ,
this is governed a Weibull distribution .

abstract.original_text: where c i and d i are the scale and shape parameters, with i ∈ {H, V } denoting the parameters for host and vectors. The host and vector population were assumed to be constant, with M denoting the ratio if vectors to hosts, so a new individual immediately replaces an individual that has been the terminated.

with i ∈ ( H , V ) denoting the parameters for host and vectors .
The host and vector population were assumed to be constant ,

so a new individual immediately replaces an individual that has been the terminated .
